alert.note: Alert for Sabine (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 29 at 7:18PM CST until further notice by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of northwest Louisiana and northeast Texas, including the following counties and parish, in northwest Louisiana, Sabine. In northeast Texas, Sabine and San Augustine. * WHEN...Until 1030 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 718 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Milam, Hemphill, Pineland, Yellowpine, Columbus, Fairmount, Negreet and McElroy. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
